recommendations: Regular exercise - 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic physical activity a week
Consider DA's 10-week Corporate Weight Loss Program
Consider DA Corporate Smoking Cessation Program

highDensityLipidCholesterol.condition: have low level of \textbf{high-density lipid cholesterol} ($\leq$ 39 mg/dL)\newline \newline
recommendations: Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make healthier
lifestyle choices. Highlight health risks and increase awareness
for better control of cholesterol levels.

lowDensityLipidCholesterol.condition: have elevated level of \textbf{low-density lipid cholesterol} ($\geq$ 160 mg/dL)\newline \newline
recommendations: Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make healthier
lifestyle choices. Highlight health risks and increase awareness
for better control of cholesterol levels.

systolicBloodPressure.condition: have elevated \textbf{systolic blood pressure} at or above 140 mmHg (pre-hypertensive and hypertensive levels)\newline \newline
recommendations: Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make wiser food
choices and increase awareness for better control of hypertension.

diastolicBloodPressure.condition: have elevated \textbf{diastolic blood pressure} at or above 90 mmHg
recommendations: Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make wiser food
choices and increase awareness for better control of hypertension.
Consume less carbohydrates (e.g. rice, noodles, sweets)
Consider DA Corporate Diabetes Management Program
Designate smoke-free periods and/or fixed intervals for smoking
during office hours. Encourage self-imposed daily smoking limits.
Promote enrolment into Smoking Cessation programmes.
Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make healthier
lifestyle choices. Highlight health risks and increase awareness
for better control of cholesterol levels.
Promote physical activity programmes at your workplace, e.g.,
dance-based workouts or high-intensity interval trainings during
lunch hours and/or after hours.
Promote physical activity programmes at your workplace, e.g.,
dance-based workouts or high-intensity interval trainings during
lunch hours and/or after hours.

glucose.condition: have elevated levels of \textbf{blood glucose} (> 108 mg/dL)
recommendations: Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make wiser food
choices and increase awareness to prevent and manage diabetes.
Promote nutritional and fitness health talks to make healthier
lifestyle choices. Highlight health risks and increase awareness
for better control of cholesterol levels.

egfr.condition: have \textbf{eGFR levels} indicating at least moderate loss of kidney function (< 45 mL/min/1.73m2)
recommendations: Stop smoking
Drink in moderation
Eat healthy
Regular exercise - 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic physical activity a week
Manage high blood pressure and diabetes if present

Drink in moderation
Eat healthy
Regular exercise - 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic physical activity a week
Manage high blood pressure and diabetes if present
Reduce alcohol consumption

habits-alcoholIntake.condition: drink \textbf{$\geq$ 15} units of alcohol per week
recommendations: Promote alcohol-free beverages and fitness health talks to make
wiser beverages choices and increase awareness of the health
implications from high level of alcohol consumptions.
